text: {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Bicol Region |other_name = Region V |settlement_type = Region |image_skyline = |image_alt = |image_caption = |nicknames = |image_flag = |flag_size = 120x80px |image_seal = |seal_size = 100x80px |image_map = |map_caption = Location in the Philippines |nickname = |motto = |coordinates = |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = |subdivision_type1 = Island group |subdivision_name1 = Luzon |seat_type = Regional center |seat = Legazpi |leader_title = |leader_name = |area_total_km2 = 18,155.82 |area_footnotes = |population_as_of = 2015 |population_total = 5,796,989 |population_footnotes = |population_density_km2 = auto |timezone = PST |utc_offset = +8 |iso_code = PH-05 |blank_name_sec1 = Provinces |blank_info_sec1 = |blank1_name_sec1 = Cities |blank1_info_sec1 = |blank2_name_sec1 = Municipalities |blank2_info_sec1 = 107 |blank3_name_sec1 = Barangays |blank3_info_sec1 = 3,471 |website = }} The Bicol Region is a region of the Philippines. It is also known as Region V. The regional center and largest city is Legazpi City."DILG Regional Office No. 5 Directory" . Bicol Region Official website; retrieved 22 May 2012. Bicol had six provinces. Four are on the Bicol Peninsula mainland â€“ Albay, Camarines Norte, Camarines Sur, and Sorsogon. Two are the islands provinces of Catanduanes and Masbate."Overview of Bicol Region" . Department of Agriculture Web Site; retrieved 22 May 2012. Mayon is the tallest volcano in the region. Mount Bulusan is the other active volcano in the region. ==References==
